comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content:
That house still stands, and except for the shutters,looks almost untouched 80 years later.  I took this photo in 2009:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/91829349@N00/3775376001/in/set-72157620805060921]

(See correction below)

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks rjones for the great photograph! Our Carnegie Survey of the Architecture of the South (CSAS) Collection includes a black & white version of this image and other views of the house including interiors. Just enter the name of the house in the search box, www.loc.gov/pictures/collection/csas/

comment.author: 7710843@N03
comment._content:
The house shown here has two pairs of pillars on the front porch.  Doing a search with Google-maps-street-view; this house can be found at this address: 525 East Front Street.

Google-maps shows the house at 93 East Front Street, is made of wood.  

Not sure Google maps may be slightly off.

comment.author: 24549021@N08
comment._content:
I'm so happy to see all of the LOC photos and esp. FBJ's.  
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/91829349@N00] 
Such a gorgeous photograph; it's good to know that some of the places she photographed are still standing as so many have vanished.

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: lawsonpix is correct -- my photo is actually of the house next door to this one, but this one still stands too.  I've walked by them a half-dozen times and never noticed until now how nearly identical they are.  I suspect the city has renumbered the street since this picture was made.
